page.title: 04Caldicot Sorting Office
page.content: The sorting office which can be found on Newport Road opened about 20 years ago. Twenty two people work there including auxiliary staff. The employees generally work day shifts from 5.15 a.m. There are four collections a day from main post boxes. The letters are sorted by hand then coded by machine or by hand and put into pigeon holes. Parcels are sorted by hand and placed in special mail bags. Caldicot sorting office serves an area which extends to Penhow, Redwick, Caerwent and Portwall. On average about 7,600 letters per week pass through the sorting office.
